timeline.message: Add getter and setter for id.

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure if this is a good approach. In the future, we will have only one programming submission per commit (that was pushed to the remote). Then it could happen that multiple builds add multiple build logs.
Users might see the same build errors multiple times then.
I would suggest that we simply replace all build logs here. In case they are identical, this makes more sense.
In case they have changed, the old ones might not be valid any more.
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText:
I see your point, however this comment is regarding multiple jobs within one build (-> one submission).
We currently only use one job but as the bamboo plugin offers a set of jobs, we should take log entries of every job into account.
So I suggest to clear the log entries before the for-loop and then adding the log entries of all jobs (although we most likely only have one) to the cleared list.
replies.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: sounds good, just make sure that the same logs are not added twice ;-)
replies.author: krusche

timeline.message: Move to changesets into one changeset.
Store build logs correctly, fetch them if possible & filter them.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe it's me but this comment is hard to read

replies.bodyText: I agree :D Maybe: Set the received logs in order to avoid duplicate entries

replies.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: Now that this class becomes an entity, you should also take the id into account for equals and for hashCode
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: Why do you fetch the programming submission with build logs here? Could you just use the programmingSubmission from a line above?
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: Good catch! I first thought that, in order to set the build logs, they have to be present (i.e. not be a proxy), but as we are only setting them (and not getting), it is not required. I've changed it.
replies.author: sleiss

timeline.message: Adjust equals & hashCode functions. Remove unnecessary fetch.
